Midway between the ganglion and the 
point of division, the diverging bands give off 
each a thin band which runs to the lateral

<u>The Homology of Structure of Salpa and 
Pyrosoma and of these with the ordinary 
Ascidians - <\u>
It seems to have been pretty generally 
admitted by naturalists that the Tunicata 
are susceptible of division into two great classes 
the monochitonida & dichitonida - characterized 
by certain differences in the structure of the 
branchiae and in the degree of adhesion of the 
<s>[text?]<\u> inner and outer tunics -
Of the two species, whose structure has been 
described - Salpa and Pyrosoma - the former 
was placed among the monochitonida - (or “those 
having the inner sac adherent throughout to 
the outer tunic “) which the latter, was reckoned 
among the dichitonida (or those “whose inner 
sac is adherent to the outer tunic, at its two 
orifices, only “)
<s>But with regard to these two species at any 
rate it is quite evident that if the facts 
stated [text?] be correct - there is no <s>
